char.dialogue: (smiling) I checked it out. It's clean.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Oh. KIMBALL Now where were you? (He laughs)

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (Laughing with him) Where was Marcus?

char.name: KIMBALL
char.dialogue: He wasn't with Paul Owen.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: So who was he with?

char.name: KIMBALL
char.dialogue: He was at Atlantis with Craig McDermott, Frederick Dibble, Harry Newman, George Butner and  (He pauses, Then looks up) - you.

scene.meta: A moment of stunned silence.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Oh, right. Of course...We had wanted Paul Owen to come. But he said he had plans...I guess I had dinner with Victoria...the following night.

char.name: KIMBALL
char.dialogue: Personally I think the guy went a little nutso. Split town for a while. Maybe he did go to London. Sightseeing. Drinking. Whatever. Anyway, I'm pretty sure he'll turn up sooner or later. (A pause) I mean, to think that one of his friends killed him, for no reason whatsoever would be too ridiculous. Isn't that right, Patrick?

scene.meta: McDermott stops by the table. McDERMOTT KIMBALL! How's the investigation? Talking to Bateman? Don't believe a word he says. (Laughs uproariously slapping him on the back) Bateman, what's wrong with ,you? Bateman looks at him in silence, panicking. McDERMOTT You can't eat at Smith and Wollensky without ordering the hash browns. Jesus, Bateman, you're a raving maniac. Been at Pierce & Pierce too long. (He wanders off muttering) No fucking hash browns...

scene.sceneheader: INT. PAUL OWEN'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY
scene.meta: Bateman walks into the lobby of Paul Owen's building. He has a surgical mask in one hand.

char.name: DOORMAN
char.dialogue: What can I do for you, sir?

char.name: DOORMAN
char.dialogue: Of course. Mrs. Wolfe is up there right now.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Mrs. Wolfe?

char.name: DOORMAN
char.dialogue: The real estate agent? You do have an appointment, don't you?

scene.meta: Bateman steps out of the elevator and walks cautiously down the hallway. Owen's door is open. The apartment is freshly painted and has been immaculately redecorated in English country-house style: overstuffed sofas, lots of chintz. There are flowers everywhere, and a YOUNG YUPPIE COUPLE stands admiring the place talkingto the realtor, MRS. WOLFE. Bateman wanders down the hallway, looking for familiar signs. He stops at the closet where we last saw two dead girls hanging. He opens the door and the light switches on, but it is empty. Mrs. Wolfe approaches, smiling.

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: Are you my two o'clock?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: No.

scene.meta: Mrs. Wolfe eyes him strangely, then looks down at the surgical mash clutched in his hand. Her expression changes.

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: Can I help you?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: I'm looking for...Paul Owen's...place.

scene.meta: She stares at him impassively.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Doesn't he live here?

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: No, he doesn't.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Are you sure?

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: You saw the ad in the Times?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: No. Yes. I mean yes, I did. In the Times. But... doesn't Paul Owen still live here?

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: There was no ad in the Times.

scene.meta: Bateman is shaking as they continue to stare at each other.

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: I think you should go now.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: But I think...I want to know what happened here.

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: Don't make any trouble. Please. I suggest you go.

scene.meta: Bateman backs away slowly.

char.name: MRS. WOLFE
char.dialogue: Don't come back.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: I won't...don't worry.

scene.meta: Mrs. Wolfe glares at him as he walks down the hall, rattled, and gets into the elevator.

Bateman enters the revolving door of an office building, panicking and breathing heavily. He is sweating, his hair is wild, and he looks deranged. He goes around the revolving door twice and comes out onto the street again, where he bumps smack into a GUY just like him.

char.name: GUY
char.dialogue: Hey, Kinsley.

scene.meta: Bateman looks up at him wild-eyed.

char.name: GUY
char.dialogue: See you at Fluties, okay?

scene.meta: The guy walks away, utterly unfazed. Bateman wanders down the street, banging his briefcase against walls, garbage cans, etc.
Bateman searches his pockets for pills. He finds three different pills and swallows them. He's sweating, and takes his jacket off to wipe his face, dialing a number.

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Patrick Bateman's office.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Jean? Hello? Jean?

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Patrick? Is that you?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Hello? Jean, I need help!

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Where are you?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Jean-I'm not-

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Craig McDermott called. He wants to meet you and David Van Patten and Tim Price at Harry's for drinks.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Oh God, what did you say, you dumb bitch?

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Patrick? I can't hear you.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: What are I doing?

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Where are you? Patrick, what's wrong?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: I don't think I'm gonna make it, Jean.

scene.meta: Pause.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: ...to the office this afternoon.

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Why?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (Screaming) Just...say...no!

char.name: JEAN (O.S.)
char.dialogue: What is it, Patrick? Are you alright?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Stop sounding so Fucking sad! Jesus!

scene.meta: He hangs up. He throws the Walkman which is around his neck into a nearby trash can, and wipes his face with his jacket.
Jean sits at Bateman's desk. She looks around, and then opens his desk drawer and tentatively begins to search through it.

Bateman comes into the bar, a little cleaned up from the previous scene (he's smoothed his hair), but still panicking and disheveled. He spots his friends in a corner, sits down, still breathing heavily. Price is on his cell-phone, trying to get reservations. McDERMOTT Bateman, you're looking a little wild-eyed rough day at the office? They all laugh. McDERMOTT Hey, look-Price is back. And he's drinking Perrier. He s a changed man. Except...he still can't get a reservation to save his life. Bateman sits down silently. McDERMOTT Why don't you try I 50 Wooster? Just fucking call them.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (On automatic) I'm not going anywhere unless we have a reservation.

char.name: VAN PATTEN
char.dialogue: Le Cirque, Flamingo East, Oyster Bar, come on, faggots-just get a res.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: Keep your shirt on. Maybe lose the suspenders.

scene.meta: Bateman spots HAROLD CARNES at the bar, tenses.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (He downs his drink) Excuse me, gentlemen. Right back. He approaches Carnes cautiously.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Face it-the Japanese will own most of this country by the end of the '90s.

scene.meta: Bateman approaches, trying to act casual.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Shut up, Carnes, they will not.

scene.meta: Carnes is surprised, turns around, looks vaguely confused.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: So, Harold, did you get my message?

scene.meta: Carnes lights a cigarette, stalling. Then laughs.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Jesus, Davis. Yes. That was hilarious. That was you, wasn't it?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (Waving smoke out of his face) Yes, naturally.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Bateman killing Owen and the escort girls? Oh that s fabulous. That's rich...

scene.meta: Pause

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: It was a pretty long message, wasn't it?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: What exactly do you mean?

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: The message you left.

scene.meta: Carnes is distracted, waving at people.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: By the way Davis, how is Cynthia? You're still seeing her, right?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: But wait, Harold, what do you mean?

scene.meta: Carnes isn't really listening.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Excuse me. Nothing. Good to see you. Is that Edward Towers?

scene.meta: He turns to go.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Carnes? Wait.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: (Sighing) Davis. I'm not one to bad-mouth anyone, your joke was amusing. But come on, man, you had one fatal flaw: Bateman's such a dork, such a boring, spineless lightweight, that I couldn't fully appreciate it. I wasn't fooled for a second. Now, if you'd said Price, or McDermott...Otherwise, it was amusing. Now, let's have lunch or dinner or something. Hilarious, Davis. A killer.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: What are you talking about? Bateman is what?

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Oh Christ. He can barely pick up an escort girl, let alone...what was it you said he did to her?

scene.meta: Carnes looks around the club, raises his glass to a passing couple. He laughs politely.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Now, if you'll excuse me, I really must...

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: (Desperate, shouting) Wait. Stop. You don't seem to understand. You're not really comprehending any of this. I killed him. I did it, Carnes. I'm Patrick Bateman. I chopped Owen's fucking head off. I tortured dozens of girls. The whole message I left on your machine was true.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Excuse me. I really must he going.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: No! Listen, don't you know who I am? I'm not Davis, I'm Patrick Bateman! I talk to you on the phone all the time! Don't you recognize me? You're my lawyer.

scene.meta: Carnes stares at him in confusion and annoyance.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Now, Carnes, listen to me. Listen very, very carefully. I killed Paul Owen and I liked it. I can't make myself any clearer

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: But that's simply not possible. And I don't find this funny anymore.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: It never was supposed to he! Why isn't it possible?

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: (Eyeing Bateman worriedly) It's just not.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Why not, you stupid bastard?

scene.meta: Carnes stares at him.

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Because I had dinner with Paul Owen twice in London...just ten days ago.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: No, you...didn't?

char.name: CARNES
char.dialogue: Now, if you'll excuse me.

scene.meta: Bateman returns back to his friends' table, in a daze. They are all looking at the television, where Ronald Reagan is giving a speech about Iran Contra. They are halfheartedly arguing about whether or not he's lying.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: How can he lie like that? How can he pull that shit?

char.name: VAN PATTEN
char.dialogue: What shit? Now where do we have reservations at? I mean I'm not really hungry, but I would like to have reservations somewhere.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: (To Bateman) I don't believe it. He looks so...normal. He seems so... out of it. So...undangerous.

scene.meta: McDERMOTT He is totally harmless you geek. Was totally harmless. Just like you are totally harmless. But he did do all that shit and you have failed lo get us into I 50, so, you know, what can I say?

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: I just don't see how someone, anyone, can appear that way and yet be involved in such total shit. How can you be so fucking, I don't know, cool about it?

char.name: VAN PATTEN
char.dialogue: Some guys are just born cool, I guess.

scene.meta: Bateman laughs at this. Price shoots him a look.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: And Bateman, what are YOU SO fucking zany about?

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: I'm just a happy camper. Rockin' and a-rollin'.

char.name: VAN PATTEN
char.dialogue: (To Price) Rehab's done wonders for you, pal. Working for UNICEF now?

scene.meta: McDERMOTT Do you want another Perrier Timothy? Some seltzer water?

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: Oh brother look-he presents himself as a harmless Old codger. But inside...

scene.meta: Pause.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: But inside...

scene.meta: The SOUNDS OF THE BAR FADE AWAY and we hear Bateman's thoughts:

char.name: BATEMAN (V.O.)
char.dialogue: But inside doesn't matter...

scene.meta: THE SOUNDS OF THE BAR RETURN. McDERMOTT (Bored) Inside? Yes, inside? Believe it or not, Price we're actually listening to you.

char.name: PRICE
char.dialogue: Bateman? Come on, what do you think?

scene.meta: Bateman looks up and smiles at Price. Then shrugs.

char.name: BATEMAN
char.dialogue: Whatever.

scene.meta: The conversation breaks up as Van Patten takes out his phone.

char.name: VAN PATTEN
char.dialogue: Whose moronic idea was it to drink dry beers? I need a Scotch.

scene.meta: The sounds of the bar fade down. The following voiceover runs over images of Bateman and his friends ordering drinks, talking on portable phones, talking, laughing - combined with images of other very similar young men at other tables drinking, talking on portable phones, talking, laughing,

char.name: BATEMAN (V.O.)
char.dialogue: There are no more barriers to cross. All I have in common with the uncontrollable and the insane, the vicious and the evil, all the mayhem I have caused and my utter indifference toward it, I have now surpassed...

scene.meta: Jean is alone in Bateman's office, looking through his diary. We see the pages that she is looking at. They are filled with doodles of mutilated women and their names...Jean looks lost and frightened, and begins to cry.

char.name: BATEMAN (V.O.)
char.dialogue: My pain is constant and sharp and I do not hope for a better world for anyone. I fact I want my pain to be inflicted on others. I want no escape.

scene.meta: leaning back in his leather armchair, drinking a double Scotch, his eyes blank.

char.name: BATEMAN (V.O.)
char.dialogue: But even after admitting this, there is no catharsis. I gain no deeper knowledge about myself, no new knowledge can be extracted from my telling. There has been no reason for me to tell you any of this. This confession has meant nothing...

scene.meta: The camera moves up to a sign on the wall behind him: "THIS IS NOT AN EXIT."
